resources.string: Internet Protocol Television (IPTV) is a system where television services are delivered using the Internet protocol suite over a packet-switched network such as a LAN or the Internet, instead of being delivered through traditional terrestrial, satellite signal, and cable television formats. IPTV offers a wide range of channels and on-demand content, providing users with a flexible and interactive viewing experience.

IPTV services can be classified into three main categories: live television, time-shifted media, and video on demand. Live television allows users to watch live broadcasts, while time-shifted media lets them watch previously aired shows. Video on demand provides users with a catalog of videos from which to choose. IPTV is known for its high-quality streaming and the ability to integrate with other IP-based services like VoIP and high-speed Internet.
